title: Cooperative Development of Operational Safety and Continuing Airworthiness Programme
decision_details: - "Cooperative Development of Operational Safety and Continuing Airworthiness Programme - South Asia" has been started in the year 1997 with the cooperation of the South Asian countries namely, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka under the aegis of the International Civil Aviation Organization. The respective States must grant the annual cost contribution for the said programme and Sri Lanka has paid the contributions up to Phase V as of now. In order to achieve 08 objectives under Phase VI of the said programme, a programme has been planned for a period of 05 years. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to pay annual contributions of US$ 95,848 each for the next five 05 years of the said programme and to provide the necessary support to the International Civil Aviation Organization for the implementation of relevant programmes, was approved by the Cabinet.
